sn1.20:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha in the Hot Springs Monastery.
sn1.20:4.3: Then Venerable Samiddhi rose before dawn and went to the hot springs to bathe.
sn1.20:4.4: When he had bathed and come out he stood in one robe drying himself.
sn1.20:4.5: Then, late at night, a beautiful deity, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to Samiddhi,
sn1.20:4.6: and, standing in the air, addressed him in verse:
sn1.20:5.1: “Mendicant, you seek alms before you eat;
sn1.20:5.2: you wouldn’t seek alms after eating.
sn1.20:5.3: But you should eat first, then seek alms:
sn1.20:5.4: don’t let the time pass you by.”

sn1.20:7.1: Then that deity landed on the ground and said to Samiddhi:
sn1.20:7.2: “You’ve gone forth while young, mendicant. You’re black-haired, blessed with youth, in the prime of life, and you’ve never flirted with sensual pleasures.
sn1.20:7.4: Don’t give up what you see in the present life to chase after what takes time.”
sn1.20:8.2: I’m giving up what takes time to chase after what I see in the present life.
sn1.20:8.3: For the Buddha has said that sensual pleasures take time, with much suffering and distress, and they’re all the more full of drawbacks.
sn1.20:8.5: But this teaching is realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.”
sn1.20:9.1: “But in what way, mendicant, has the Buddha has said that sensual pleasures take time, with much suffering and distress, and they’re all the more full of drawbacks?
sn1.20:9.2: And how is this teaching realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves?”
sn1.20:10.1: “I’m junior, good sir, recently gone forth, newly come to this teaching and training.
sn1.20:10.2: I’m not able to explain this in detail.
sn1.20:10.3: But the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha is staying near Rājagaha in the Hot Springs Monastery.
sn1.20:10.4: You should go to him and ask about this matter.
sn1.20:10.5: And you should remember it in line with the Buddha’s answer.”
